alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties; Northern Washoe County; Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 2:08PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...Shower and thunderstorm chances continue... * Showers and thunderstorms will continue through this evening. These storms will be capable of gusts in excess of 45 mph, which could kick up dust from desert sinks and playas, in addition to localized heavy rainfall. Additional storm chances continue into the weekend. * Remnant tropical moisture, from what is currently Hurricane Hilary will surge into the southwest US Sunday through Tuesday. How this interacts with a trough off the west coast will have varying implications on the forecast for the eastern Sierra and western Nevada. * What we know: This moisture will bring additional rounds of showers and thunderstorms Sunday through Tuesday, with most areas receiving wetting rains. High temperatures will also be cooler, 10-15 degrees below normal. The best chances for higher liquid totals will be across southern Mono/Mineral Counties, where there is a 60% chance to exceed 1 inch. * Uncertainties: Exactly how much liquid (QPF) the area will see from the rain as there are still a wide range of potential scenarios. Localized flood concerns from heavy rainfall are certainly possible, particularly in the southern Sierra and White Mountains. Stay-tuned for the latest!

area.areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties; Northern Washoe County; Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake
